item.title: Tropical Storm Beryl tracker: Map and projected storm path
item.dc:creator: Nick Kirkpatrick, Dylan Moriarty, Szu Yu Chen
item.description: Beryl is expected to bring heavy rain, hurricane-force winds, and dangerous storm surge and surf to the Lesser Antilles.

item.title: U.S. suspends Gaza aid pier again; fighting continues in Shejaiya
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Victoria Bisset, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: U.S.-built pier is again suspended due to high seas, says Pentagon. The U.N. warns “at least 60,000 people” have been displaced from Gaza’s Shejaiya area as fighting continues.

item.title: The far right was humiliated in this city. Its return bodes ill for Macron.
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: The port city of Toulon helps explain the far right’s appeal in France and, critics say, the risks of entrusting it with government responsibilities.

item.title: Iran heads to presidential runoff pitting reformist against conservative
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: Turnout in the first round of voting hit a historic low. But some people hope the pro-reform candidate’s will mobilize voters ahead of the runoff July 5.

item.title: In Egypt, Gaza evacuees live in the shadows: ‘Everything is closing in’
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Lorenzo Tugnoli, Hazem Balousha
item.description: Displaced Palestinians in Cairo have found sanctuary from war and a measure of calm, but are unable to build a future.

item.title: Airline apologizes after plane left passengers in wheelchairs on tarmac
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wu
item.description: An EasyJet flight left Belfast as Liz Weir, who uses a wheelchair, waited on the tarmac to board.

item.title: As tensions soar, U.S. pushes for deal to avert Israel-Lebanon war
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, John Hudson, Sarah Dadouch
item.description: The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah says its fighters won’t stand down from attacking Israel until there is a permanent cease-fire in Gaza.

item.title: Iran extends voting hours in snap election for a new president
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: For Iran’s ruling clerics, the public’s participation in elections is important to maintain the regime’s legitimacy, even as Iranians grow more disillusioned.

item.title: Orphaned as babies, these elephants returned to the wild amid bittersweet tears
item.dc:creator: Ami Vitale, Rael Ombuor
item.description: Kapai and her herd were “rewilded” this month after years in an innovative Kenyan sanctuary, where keepers restored their health and prepared them to live free.

item.title: Homeland Security extends temporary protected status for Haitians
item.dc:creator: Maria Sacchetti
item.description: The expansion makes an additional 309,000 Haitians eligible for temporary protected status.

item.title: How the world reacted to Biden’s ‘disastrous’ debate performance
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum
item.description: If global leaders weren’t already hedging their bets about a future Trump presidency, they sure are now.

item.title: A weekend in Kharkiv: Beach, ping-pong, poetry jams, Russian bombs
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Kostiantyn Khudov, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: As Russia pummels Ukraine’s second-largest city with glide bombs, Kharkiv is relishing the rituals of early summer, which residents say, is a form of resistance.

item.title: Monsoon rains collapse roof at New Delhi airport, crushing cars and killing 1
item.dc:creator: Anant Gupta, Karishma Mehrotra
item.description: India has seen an infrastructure boom to meet rising demands for transportation, but there have been criticisms about poor maintenance and oversight of building.

item.title: Why China’s Communist Party expelled two former defense ministers
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd
item.description: The tough language in the expulsion announcement suggests Chinese leader Xi Jinping is not done with his effort to ensure total loyalty in the world’s largest army.

item.title: Post publisher’s role in hacking response comes into sharper focus
item.dc:creator: Aaron Davis, Greg Miller, Sarah Ellison, Isaac Stanley-Becker
item.description: Former U.K. prime minister Gordon Brown calls for William Lewis to be criminally investigated. Lewis says he “did nothing wrong.”

item.title: In France’s rebranded far right, flashes of antisemitism and racism persist
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: Ahead of French elections, vitriol and innuendo from National Rally candidates amplify doubts about how much the party of Marine Le Pen has truly evolved.

item.title: The French far right is leading in election polls. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections that begin on Sunday.

item.title: The twilight of Macronism
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: In the upcoming parliamentary elections in France, no realistic scenario looks good for French President Emmanuel Macron.
